data.title: What's so special?
data.text: It has a '50s vibe, but primarily just because the buildings seem to fit that era.  There really isn't a great flow or feeling from one store front to the other.  A few restaurants, a few coffee shops, and not much else.  Ice cream on one of the side streets was good, though!  Anyway, hard to see this as a destination of any kind.  Perhaps the wrong day, or the wrong season?

data.title: It is nice to have a "center" of town.
data.text: Tuesday farmer's market is fun,. 2nd Saturday events and Cruising Grand in the spring and summer.  Lots of places to eat and meet up with friends.

data.title: Better each year
data.text: Grand Ave is changing for the better and is now quite popular for its bakery/deli,  wine cafe, and car show on Friday afternoons in the summer.  There are still some junk shops, but there's also a couple of art galleries, an outdoor equipment/clothing store, a beauty salon (a nice one), and a guitar shop (with lessons).   Plus farmer's markets weekly,

data.title: Downtown evening walk
data.text: The walk along Grand during the Friday car shows and festivities is really fun and nice.  So many restaurants and goodies to enjoy.  See people you know and more that you don't but will.  Very friendly and enjoyable.  Even for kids and pets!

data.title: Cruisin' Grand on Friday Nights, Restaurants, Shops, Antiques
data.text: Be sure to stop in Escondido to explore Grand Avenue.  There are some really good little restaurants to discover, a wonderful antique mall, unique shops,  homemade gelato, and Friday nights between April and October the classic automoblies and trucks are out on display!   Street fair atmosphere -- live music and lots of fun.

data.title: An Escondido Classic
data.text: Spring and summer has clearly arrived in Escondido when the Friday night "Crus'in Grand" is in full speed. Great vintage and muscle car viewing, along with a variety of restaurants, breweries, and shops open. Small town feel. Great for summer evening walk and people watching. Usually has a live band playing and some activity for children. Family friendly outing.

data.title: Great part of Escondido...
data.text: Grand Ave. is the downtown street of Escondido...with lots of restaurants, coffee shops, micro-breweries and other shops.  Visit on a Friday night from May-October and be a part of Crusin' Grand - a huge weekly car show with live music and extra food vendors.

data.title: Farmers Market-Cruisin Grand
data.text: Both fun events, Farmers Market held Tuesday and provides local farm fresh items and a few other items sprinkled in such a fresh baked bread, honey etc. There are lots of wonderful veggies, fruits and flowers grown locally, it's fun to explore and buy direct from the farmer.  Friday's is cruising grand with vintage classic cars for those auto lovers. Makes for a fun festive Friday, with vendors serving ice cream, popcorn, live music and retail establishments offering special dining options.  Parking is tough is an understatement plan ahead go early and scope out neighboring parking areas, plan to walk a lot....not a good event for those with walking challenges too crowded and difficult to navigate.

data.title: Classic Cars, People Watching, Family Friendly, Nice Restruants
data.text:
There is always a good time to be had during the Friday night car shows along Grand Avenue.

This family friendly event never disappoints. There are always new and different cars to see each week as hundreds of classic car enthusiasts share their passion up and down the avenue.

Restaurants, pubs and shops stay open to welcome and accommodate the crowds. 

The show runs from 5 - 9, but the fun continues after in the bars and pubs.

Net-Net: We try to get here 3-4 times a year.

data.title: Funky Town
data.text: It is my understanding that several attempts have been made over the years to revitalize downtown Escondido.  It looks like they are finally on their way.  Grand Avenue is mostly known for their Friday night classic car display during the summer.  But further investigation reveals many interesting little shops and services as well as restaurants of any type of cuisine you could imagine.  A great place to spend the day!

data.title: Love Crusin' Grand
data.text: The street fairs and Crusin' Grand through the summer are so much fun. Tuesday's Farmer's Markets always have the best buys and not just fruits and veggies,

data.title: Routine visit.
data.text: Variable types of business, Easy access Lots o good parking, Friendly people. Courtesy abounds. Very enjoyable. I always enjoy seeing what is going on in my town.

data.title: Disappointing after reading the review on Trip Advisor
data.text: There's not much on Grand Ave. in Escondido. Several store fronts are empty. The used book store is nice and the art gallery is okay. There is a gift shop that is nice, too. Yes, there are some cafes and places to eat. But for the quintessential Main Street, I say to go La Mesa!!

data.title: Quintessential Main Street
data.text: Whether you are here for the farmers market, Cruisin' Grand auto show, local dining or shopping, Grand Avenue offers the best 'small town' main street experience I have ever had.  What a great place to spend an afternoon or enjoy a meal.

data.title: Stroll to enjoy locally produced goods.
data.text: Tuesday's in Escondido offer a wide variety of locally produced fruits, vegetables, flowers and goods as well as delicious eats from street vendors.  It's a delight to see and experience.  You won't be able to resist the wonderful offerings.

data.title: Always a nice stroll
data.text: Something for everyone; many different types of restaurants, tea room, bakeries, antique shops, day spa, all worth your time to check out!

data.title: Seasonal fun
data.text: Escondido has a "main drag", and that is Grand Ave. Not a lot goes on during the winter, however, in the summer, Grand Avenue comes alive on Tuesdays with the Farmers Market, and Friday nights, for Cruisin' Grand. Very family oriented and lots of great old cars. We don't seem to be able to get things going elsewhere in Escondido, so this is the place for action.

data.title: Come on Friday night (Apr-Oct) for Cruisin' Grand
data.text: Old cars galore!  Lots of people!  You can walk or slowly drive through, seeing all kinds of vintage and antique cars, trucks, motorcycles, and other vehicles.  Most are restored and beautiful, some are still a work in progress but have been brought out to cruise! Lots of bands, playing on corners, food, activity.  Fun for all ages!

data.title: A charming place
data.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our peaceful evening walk in Escondido, after our visits to the bigger cities of LA and San Diego. It's a charming little town, with all the amenities yu could wish for.

data.title: Cruising Grand, awesome car show
data.text: On Friday night from April through September there is a classic car show with a different theme each week. Prepare to park and walk up and down Grand avenue and enjoy several bands, food on the patio of numerous restaurants and the best car show west of the Mississippi. Fun for everyone, all ages, and even your pooch.
